author: peter.davies
content: For security reasons people are unlikely to do validation and JSON-RPC endpoint jobs on the same node.

author: sky.cactus
content: I find this claim to be unlikely to be true.

author: sky.cactus
content: Perhaps you meant "...people should not do..." rather than "...people are unlikely to do..."?

author: peter.davies
content: I actually meant that in a healthy network there are likely to be lots of validator nodes and lots of JSON RPC nodes that don't validate and probably not much overlap between the two categories.

author: sky.cactus
content: My suspicion is that there will be lots of JSON-RPC only nodes, but almost all validating nodes will run on the same host as an execution client, and the cost of running an execution client is currently so high that almost none of those people are going to want to run a *separate* one for serving JSON-RPC requests.

author: sky.cactus
content: So you have the set of people who operate JSON-RPC nodes only, and the set of people who operate JSON-RPC nodes + Validating nodes, and the set of people who run only validating nodes.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the third set is very few people.  The middle set is a lot of people, and they'll probably all run both on the same host.

author: sky.cactus
content: The first set *may* be larger than the second set, but I'm not confident in that.

author: yorickdowne
content: Not disagreeing, putting amounts to the cost: Between 80 and 140 usd/month per execution client, If renting the barebones from someone. Can be lower if doing a colo, depends really

author: yorickdowne
content: 80 is hetzner with Ryzen and 1TB NVMe; 140 is ovh with xeon and 1.9TB NVMe

author: yorickdowne
content: That’s for “production grade”. For a solo staker with a single validator, 21 to 30 euro/month at netcup does the trick.
